news.title: Trump says the Fed should cut rates to ease the economy’s transition to his tariffs
news.summary: President Donald Trump is encouraging the central bank to cut interest rates as a backstop for his tariff plans. President Donald Trump wants the Central bank to reduce interest rates to protect the economy.

news.title: Klarna lands buy now, pay later deal with DoorDash, notching another win ahead of IPO
news.summary: Klarna is partnering with DoorDash to give users of the restaurant delivery service more ways to pay for their meals. Klarna and DoorDash will work together to make it easier for people to order food and pay for it.

news.title: AMD's Lisa Su has already vanquished Intel. Now she's going after Nvidia
news.summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su is an anomaly in semiconductors. She is the only woman to lead a major player in the industry. Su is also the first female CEO of a major U.S. chipmaker.

news.title: Darden Restaurants sales disappoint as Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse miss expectations
news.summary: Olive Garden and LongHorn Steakhouse reported weaker-than-expected same-store sales growth in Darden's latest quarter.

news.title: Trump open to extending Chevron's license to produce oil in Venezuela, WSJ reports
news.summary: The Trump administration had given Chevron until April 3 to wind down its operations. The Trump administration has given Chevron a deadline of April 3.

news.title: U.S. jobless claims still show few private-sector layoffs, but more ex-federal workers get benefits
news.summary: The private sector is still culling very few jobs, the latest report on jobless claims shows. But more federal workers fired by the Trump administration are applying for benefits.

news.title: Remember when the nickel market went haywire? The LME was just fined, 3 years later
news.summary: The U.K. financial regulator says the LME’s systems and controls were inadequate. The LME says it is investigating the allegations.

news.title: Here’s the real reason stocks rose after a do-nothing meeting, says this ex-New York Fed trader
news.summary: There was some debate after the Federal Reserve’s press conference was over whether Chair Jerome Powell was trying to convey a hawkish message or a dovish one.

news.title: Tesla has a big Elon Musk problem, and Wall Street’s biggest bull is not happy
news.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk faces a “moment of truth,” says Wedbush’s Dan Ives. Ives says Musk has two major things he has to do to fix the “crisis’ at the EV giant.

news.title: Prospective home buyers are hoping for a recession to bring down housing prices. Does that make sense?
news.summary: More than a third of Americans said they want the housing market to crash because they think it would lower home prices and property taxes. More than one-third said they think a crash would lower property taxes and home prices.
